channel.name: TypeError: Cannot set properties of undefined (setting 'isSome')

messages.content: Test without this.dailyLimit.set(maxUInt64);
Can you post your full smart contract & test?
From what i see i suspect you're using more than 8x state
yes
that looks like more than 8 pieces of state 😄
Is it possible to use delegatecall and create another smart contract?
so I can extends Basic Wallet for example
tl;dr; you can't use more than 8 pieces of state
is this possible with SnarkyJs?
see also: https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2535 as references

embeds.description: Create modular smart contract systems that can be extended after deployment.

messages.content: yep, you need to do a child account update and set a verification key to it
assuming you want to deploy a contract from a contract, which you dont have to do, you can just deploy manually as a child
interesting, let me experiment with this
any docs on this child deployment and child account update ?
@gregor ?
no, you can't make a transaction within a transaction
how about this?
no, deploy can't be async. but you could just compile outside the contract, and deploy both of them together. that part doesn't seem problematic to me
Thanks, I will deploy it outside the Wallet smart contract, how to initiate  f.e. The Recovery contract within the Wallet?
sorry, can you describe in more words what you want to do? if possible, in general terms so I don't have to understand the details of your wallet architecture?
WalletBasic is a smart contract that can call other smart contracts, like Recover Smart Contract. This way I make it more modular, because of the restrictions having 8 states on a contract
like this? https://github.com/o1-labs/snarkyjs/blob/bde00bda71babbb2f5b451949fced5601aba84ac/src/examples/zkapps/voting/voting.ts#L151

embeds.title: snarkyjs/voting.ts at bde00bda71babbb2f5b451949fced5601aba84ac  o1...
embeds.description: TypeScript framework for zk-SNARKs and zkApps. Contribute to o1-labs/snarkyjs development by creating an account on GitHub.

messages.content: Yes exactly, this is a good example for how to call other contracts!
